inclusion.criterion: participation, she will be consented for study participation and the Botox injection
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Prior to receiving treatment, patients will complete a 3-day voiding diary and the following questionnaires: Incontinence Impact Questionnaire short form (IIQ-7) and Urogenital Distress Inventory short form (UDI-6) at the time of consent.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients in both arms will receive prophylactic antibiotics (oral nitrofurantoin or cephalexin) to complete prior to the procedure date.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: On the day of treatment, patients will have a clean catch urine specimen obtained and urine dip completed.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients who have a positive urine dip will have her procedure rescheduled to another day.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: A 70-degree cystoscope will be inserted through the urethra and into the bladder until the trigone is identified; the bladder will be distended with approximately 200 mL sterile saline.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: 100 units of Botox will be mixed with 10 mL of Normal Saline for sterile injection into the bladder.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: In the reduced protocol arm, a single row of 5 injections will be administered into the detrusor muscle.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: In the standard protocol arm, 3 rows of 5 injections will be administered into the detrusor muscle.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Approximately 5 minutes post-procedure, patients will rate their pain experienced during the procedure using a 100-point visual analog pain scale.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: If the patient is unable to void post-procedure, she will be taught how to perform clean intermittent self-catheterization (CISC) and provided with a log to record void and catheter volumes.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Current symptomatic urinary tract infection that has not resolved prior to randomization.
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger

exclusion.criterion: PVR (Post void residual) >150 mL on 2 occasions with void(s) of greater than 150 mL
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Surgical treatment for stress incontinence (sling, Burch or urethral injection) or pelvic organ prolapse recommended or planned at enrollment by study investigator(s).
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Any prior intra-detrusor botulinum toxin A injections
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Previous or currently implanted neuromodulation (sacral or tibial).
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Surgically altered detrusor muscle, such as augmentation cystoplasty.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Known allergy to botulinum toxin A.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: 67-year-old healthy woman with no underlying disease. She works at a rehab center and has no allergies to any food or drugs.
